    NOOR Canvas Implementation Status Overview

    Last Updated: September 15, 2025
    Project Version: 3.1 - Major Architectural Revision
    Current Phase: Phase 4 - Dual URL Architecture Implementation

    üéØ Project Summary

    NOOR Canvas is an Islamic Content Sharing Platform built with modern web technologies, designed for real-time collaborative learning and annotation of Islamic content (Qur'an, Hadith, Etymology, and Poetry).

    Key Statistics

    • Timeline: 20 weeks across 6 development phases
    • Architecture: ASP.NET Core 8.0 + Blazor Server + SignalR + SQL Server
    • Backend Progress: 95% Complete
    • Frontend Progress: 70% Complete
    • Tools & DevOps: 90% Complete

    üèóÔ∏è Architecture Overview

    Core Technology Stack

    Component Technology Status
    Web Framework ASP.NET Core 8.0 ‚úÖ Complete
    Frontend Blazor Server üîÑ In Progress
    Real-time Communication SignalR (3 Hubs) ‚úÖ Complete
    Database SQL Server + Entity Framework Core ‚úÖ Complete
    Authentication GUID-based Session Validation ‚úÖ Complete
    Documentation DocFX + Auto-generated API docs ‚úÖ Complete

    Database Architecture

    • Canvas Schema: 13 tables with 2 applied migrations
    • KSESSIONS Integration: Read-only access for Albums/Categories/Sessions
    • Development Environment: KSESSIONS_DEV, KQUR_DEV databases
    • Connection: Optimized with 1-hour timeout for long operations

    üìà Phase-by-Phase Progress

    ‚úÖ Phase 1: Foundation (Weeks 1-3) - COMPLETED 100%

    Duration: September 2025
    Focus: Project setup, database schema, and development environment

    Completed Deliverables:

    • ‚úÖ ASP.NET Core 8.0 Project Setup - Full project structure established

    • ‚úÖ Development Environment - Ports 9090/9091 configured

    • ‚úÖ Automated Testing Framework - Comprehensive test structure

    ‚úÖ Phase 2: Core Platform (Weeks 4-8) - COMPLETED 100%

    Duration: September 2025
    Focus: Session management, authentication, and basic UI framework

    Completed Deliverables:

    • ‚úÖ Session Management System - Backend models and API controllers
    • ‚úÖ Host Authentication Infrastructure - HostController + HostProvisioner tool
    • ‚úÖ Bootstrap Foundation - Clean CSS architecture (McBeatch theme removed)
    • ‚úÖ Database Integration - KSessionsDbContext for cross-application data
    • ‚úÖ CSS Architecture - Ready for custom NOOR Canvas styling

    Known Issues:

    • ‚ùå CreateSession.razor HttpClient Issue - Issue-53 (BaseAddress configuration)
    • ‚ùå Participant Registration UX - ParticipantRegister.razor incomplete

    ‚úÖ Phase 3: Advanced Features (Weeks 9-12) - COMPLETED 100%

    Duration: September 2025
    Focus: Real-time features, Q&A system, and performance optimization

    Completed Deliverables:

    • ‚úÖ 3 SignalR Hubs - SessionHub, AnnotationHub, QAHub
    • ‚úÖ Real-time Annotation Tools - Foundation for collaborative annotations
    • ‚úÖ Q&A System Backend - Question/QuestionAnswer models
    • ‚úÖ SSL Configuration - TrustServerCertificate=true for development
    • ‚úÖ Host UX Streamlining - Direct CreateSession routing
    • ‚úÖ Performance Foundation - Basic optimization and structured logging

    Key Development Breakthrough:

    HttpClientFactory Pattern Established - Resolved authentication infrastructure

    // ‚úÖ CORRECT PATTERN (Working)
@inject IHttpClientFactory HttpClientFactory
using var httpClient = HttpClientFactory.CreateClient("default");
var response = await httpClient.GetFromJsonAsync("api/endpoint");

    üìã Remaining Phase 4 Work:

    • ‚ùå Mock Styling Extraction - Pixel-perfect design implementation
    • ‚ùå Responsive Design Testing - Mobile and desktop breakpoint validation

    üö® Major Architectural Changes

    Dual URL System with Human-Friendly Tokens

    Status: üÜï NEW REQUIREMENT - September 15, 2025

    Current System (Being Replaced):

    Single landing page with dual authentication panels
GUID-exposed URLs: https://localhost:9091/join/5ec82d65-2f89-4c05-91dd-dc9742326937

    New System (Target Implementation):

    Separate Host and User landing pages
Clean token URLs: 
- Host: https://localhost:9091/host/P7X9K2M4
- User: https://localhost:9091/user/H5T3R8W6

    Implementation Requirements:

    1. SecureTokens Database Table - Host/User token pairs with lifecycle management
    2. 8-Character Human-Friendly Tokens - A-Z, 2-9 character set (no confusing 0/O, 1/I)
    3. Dual URL Routing - /host/{token} and /user/{token} endpoints
    4. Enhanced Security - Cryptographically random tokens with expiry and audit trail

    üõ†Ô∏è Development Tools & Commands

    Global Command Suite

    Location: Workspaces/Global/ - Complete automation toolkit

    Command Purpose Status
    nc Primary application launcher with token generation ‚úÖ Operational
    nc 215 Session-specific token generation + app launch ‚úÖ Operational
    nct Standalone host token generator ‚úÖ Operational
    ncdoc DocFX documentation server (port 8050) ‚úÖ Enhanced
    iiskill Process cleanup utility ‚úÖ Operational

    Recent Tool Enhancements

    NCDOC Command - Major Improvements ‚úÖ

    Completed: September 15, 2025

    Problem Solved: Eliminated orphaned PowerShell windows when serving documentation

    Key Improvements:

    • ‚úÖ Background Job Management - No more visible windows cluttering taskbar
    • ‚úÖ Port Change - Moved from 9093 to 8050 (avoiding port conflicts)
    • ‚úÖ Intelligent Server Detection - Reuse existing servers automatically
    • ‚úÖ Force Restart Capability - ncdoc -Force for clean server restart
    • ‚úÖ Enhanced Process Management - Job-based tracking instead of PID-only

    Usage:

    ncdoc              # Start server on 8050 or reuse existing
ncdoc -Force       # Kill existing servers and restart fresh  
ncdoc -Stop        # Stop documentation server cleanly
ncdoc -Port 8060   # Use alternative port if needed
